column4: Europe shares snap two-day slide; Novo Nordisk rallies
column5: PARIS  March 27 European stocks rose in early trade on Friday  halting a sharp two-day retreat as a renewed fall in the euro helped boost exporters' shares.

column4: Novo Nordisk surges on plan to resubmit rejected insulin in U.S.
column5: Denmark's Novo Nordisk is to resubmit its new insulin Tresiba to U.S. regulators based on interim analysis data from a clinical trial  bringing its biggest new drug hope closer to the world's top market.

column4: UPDATE 2-Novo Nordisk surges on plan to resubmit rejected insulin in U.S.
column5: * Shares in Danish group hit all-time high   (Updates with shares  analyst reaction)

column4: European shares snap two-day slide; Novo Nordisk rallies
column5: PARIS  March 27 European stocks rose in early trade on Friday  halting a sharp two-day retreat as a renewed fall in the euro currency helped boost the shares of exporting companies.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: March 27 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Friday:

column4: Dow Chemical to sell most chlorine assets in $5 billion deal
column5: Dow Chemical Co  will separate a portion of its century-old chlorine business and sell it to Olin Corp  in a tax-efficient deal worth $5 billion as part of efforts to shed low-margin assets.

column4: UPDATE 4-Dow Chemical to sell most chlorine assets in $5 bln deal
column5: * Dow shares up 5 pct; Olin up 25 pct   (Adds Breakingviews link  updates share prices)

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Dow Chemical to sell most chlorine assets in $5 bln deal
column5: March 27 Dow Chemical Co said it would separate a significant part of its chlorine business and sell it to smaller rival Olin Corp in a tax-efficient deal valued at about $5 billion.

column4: Fitch Publishes Ratings Navigator for 9 Non-Alcoholic Beverage Companies
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO/LONDON  March 27 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has published its new Rating  Navigators for: --The Coca-Cola Company --Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc. --PepsiCo Inc. --Coca-Cola Icecek --Coca-Cola FEMSA SAB --Corporacion Lindley --Embotelladora Andina --Grupo Embotellador Atic --Ajecorp  These reports should be read in conjunction with the 'Introducing Rating  Navigators for Corporates' report dated Nov. 5  2014 and 'Non-Alcoholic  Beverages

column4: Brazil police arrest Grupo Galv達o CEO in Petrobras probe
column5: SAO PAULO Brazilian police on Friday arrested the CEO of Grupo Galv達o  the latest executive seized in a corruption probe focused on state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil police arrest Grupo Galv達o CEO in Petrobras probe
column5: SAO PAULO  March 27 Brazilian police on Friday arrested the CEO of Grupo Galv達o  the latest executive seized in a corruption probe focused on state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA.

column4: Brazil government names Vale CEO Ferreira to head Petrobras board
column5: SAO PAULO Brazil's government has selected Murilo Ferreira  the chief executive officer of miner Vale SA  to head the board of embattled state-run Petroleo Brasileiro SA  according to a filing from the oil company on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Brazil economy dodges recession in 2014  but trouble ahead
column5: BRASILIA  March 27 Brazil's economy grew a slightly better-than-expected 0.1 percent in 2014  but sliding investment set the stage for what most observers expect will be a painful recession this year.

column4: Petrobras to shut refinery  exit Japan: Nikkei
column5: TOKYO Brazil's state oil company Petrobras is exiting Japan due to shrinking oil demand  shutting down its refinery in Okinawa as early as this year and building an import terminal it will sell to another refiner  the Nikkei reported on Friday.

column4: Investor demand strong for highly leveraged U.S. loans
column5: NEW YORK Strong investor demand for a $700 million leveraged acquisition loan from cereal maker Post Holdings Inc  shows that institutional investors are willing to buy the highly leveraged loans that U.S. regulators are trying to curb.

column4: TRLPC: Investor demand strong for highly leveraged US loans
column5: NEW YORK  March 27 Strong investor demand for a $700 million leveraged acquisition loan from cereal maker Post Holdings Inc shows that institutional investors are willing to buy the highly leveraged loans that U.S. regulators are trying to curb.

column4: UPDATE 1-Israel Chemicals makes $109 mln offer for Allana Potash
column5: JERUSALEM/WINNIPEG  March 27 Potash producer Israel Chemicals  said on Friday it had made a C$137 million ($109.50 million) offer to buy Canada's Allana Potash  a deal it hopes will accelerate development of a mine in Ethiopia.

column4: U.S.-based shareholder of Chile's SQM demands board shake-up
column5: SANTIAGO  March 27 The largest U.S.-based shareholder of SQM has demanded an overhaul of the board and resignation of its chairman "to restore credibility" to the Chilean fertilizer company.

column4: Iron ore sinks to record low as Rio comment stokes glut worries
column5: SINGAPORE Spot iron ore prices hit new record lows on Friday while futures in China and Singapore slid as much as 4 percent before paring losses  on worries that global producers would continue to lift output in a well supplied market.

column4: UPDATE 2-Iron ore sinks to record low as Rio comment stokes glut worries
column5: * Shanghai rebar also hits record low  but cuts losses   (Updates spot price)

column4: REFILE--Rio Tinto to cut M&A headcount in saving drive - sources
column5: LONDON  March 26 Anglo Australian miner Rio Tinto  plans to cut jobs in mergers and acquisitions and business development  three sources said  to cut costs as it battles a slump in commodity prices.

column4: Switzerland's UBP to buy RBS's Coutts International
column5: ZURICH/LONDON Switzerland's Union Bancaire Privee (UBP) is buying the international business of 300-year-old British wealth manager Coutts  the latest deal by a Swiss private bank aimed at branching out from its struggling home market.

column4: UPDATE 2-Switzerland's UBP to buy RBS's Coutts International
column5: * Price to be set by assets remaining when deal closes   (Adds analyst  detail  background)

column4: Swiss private bank UBP says to buy RBS's Coutts International
column5: ZURICH  March 27 Swiss private bank Union Bancaire Privee (UBP) said on Friday it had agreed to buy Royal Bank of Scotland's international private banking arm Coutts International.

column4: BRIEF-RBS to sell private banking and wealth businesses
column5: * Sale includes relationships managed from Switzerland  Monaco  UAE  Qatar  Singapore and Hong Kong

column4: Sanofi to launch Toujeo diabetes drug in U.S. on Monday: source
column5: PARIS French drugmaker Sanofi plans to launch its new Toujeo insulin for diabetics in the United States on Monday  according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: Sanofi to launch Toujeo diabetes drug in U.S. on Monday -source
column5: PARIS  March 27 French drugmaker Sanofi  plans to launch its new Toujeo insulin for diabetics in the United States on Monday  according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: BRIEF-Sanofi Pasteur's Gardasil 9 HPV vaccine gets positive opinion from EMA
column5: * Says Gardasil 9  new HPV vaccine from Sanofi Pasteur MSD granted positive opinion by European Ccommittee for Medicinal Products for Human Use

column4: Southern Copper hit by conflicting remarks on Peru mine's future
column5: LIMA Conflicting statements about whether Southern Copper Corp would cancel development of its $1.4 billion Tia Maria copper mine in Peru's Arequipa region have battered the company's share price and left investors wondering about the project's future.

column4: UPDATE 3-Southern Copper hit by conflicting remarks on Peru mine's future
column5: * Southern Copper CEO  Grupo Mexico say Tia Maria going ahead

column4: Southern Copper still moving forward with Tia Maria Peru project - CEO
column5: LIMA  March 27 Southern Copper "will continue making efforts to move forward" with its Tia Maria project in Peru  the chief executive of the mining firm told Reuters  just hours after a company spokesman said the project was being shelved.

column4: Peru says expects Southern Copper to reverse Tia Maria cancellation
column5: LIMA  March 27 Peru's Mining and Energy Minister Rosa Maria Ortiz said on Friday Southern Copper's announcement to cancel its Tia Maria project had taken the government by surprise and that the company was expected to reverse its decision.

column4: Southern Copper says cancels $1.4 bln Tia Maria project in Peru
column5: LIMA  March 27 Southern Copper Corp has canceled its $1.4 billion Tia Maria project amid protests in Peru  Julio Morriberon  the company's head of institutional relations in the South American nation told local radio RPP on Friday.

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan's TSMC orders equipment for T$596 million
column5: March 27 Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd

column4: Spain's Telefonica says may appeal 437 mln eur tax bill in Peru
column5: MADRID  March 27 Spanish telecoms group Telefonica could see 2015 earnings hit by up to 437 million euros ($473 million) from a tax fine in Peru  the company said in a prospectus  adding that it could still appeal the ruling.

column4: Pay for top Charles Schwab Corp execs fell 5-10 percent in 2014
column5: NEW YORK Walter Bettinger  president and chief executive of Charles Schwab Corp  earned $11.8 million in cash  options and restricted stock awards in 2014  7 percent below the $12.7 million he was paid in 2013.

column4: Pay for top Charles Schwab Corp execs fell 5-10 percent in 2014
column5: NEW YORK  March 27 Walter Bettinger  president and chief executive of Charles Schwab Corp  earned $11.8 million in cash  options and restricted stock awards in 2014  7 percent below the $12.7 million he was paid in 2013.

column4: Citadel Securities to close Apogee 'dark pool': sources
column5: NEW YORK Citadel Securities  a top market maker in U.S. stocks and listed options  plans to shutter its Apogee "dark pool" to focus on another of its off-exchange stock trading venues called Citadel Connect  according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.

column4: Citadel Securities to close Apogee 'dark pool' -sources
column5: NEW YORK  March 27 Citadel Securities  a top market maker in U.S. stocks and listed options  plans to shutter its Apogee "dark pool" to focus on another of its off-exchange stock trading venues called Citadel Connect  according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.

column4: Russia's United Aircraft Corporation to get capital boost from state- TASS
column5: MOSCOW  March 27 Russian state-controlled United Aircraft Corporation will get a capital boost of 100 billion roubles ($1.75 billion) from state revenues  TASS news agency quoted Russia's President Vladimir Putin as saying on Friday.

column4: BRIEF-United reorganizes its capital group  plans to spin-off NCF SA
column5: * Said on Thursday that following decision on the reorganization of the company's capital group  buys 100 pct stake (100 000 shares) in NCF SA from its unit NCF Group Sp. z o.o. for 100 000 zlotys ($26 650)

column4: Visa to miss deadline for new Russia payment system  Mastercard on time: payment system head
column5: MOSCOW  March 27 Visa still needs one or two months to transfer processing of transactions made on its credit cards in Russia to a local payment system  but Mastercard will make an obligatory April 1 deadline  the head of the payment system said.
